main event: A cigar-shaped, silver-colored object was sighted by a teacher and two other teachers and 25 school children in Red Bluff, California on September 24, 1964.
interesting points: The object was 3 feet by 1 foot in size and had no discernible details or tail.
The object was silent and remained stationary during the 15-minute observation.
Civil Defense authorities investigated the incident but found no evidence of the object.
Weather balloons are periodically released by the weather detachment in Chico, California, about 40 miles from Red Bluff, and this sighting could have been of a weather balloon.
The wind conditions at the time of the sighting were also noted in the report.
witnesses: a teacher, two other teachers, and 25 school children
